DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Progression Documented Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the description of disease signs which show progression or relapse of CLL disease after treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)_Progression; advancement in extent or severity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  The clinical course is indolent, but this type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: Progression; advancement in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: Progression; advancement in extent or severity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the documented progression type of CLL.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid withdrawn from a lump, often a cyst, or a nipple.: A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.

Concepts.definition: Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor.

A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

PermissibleValues.value: Absolute Lymphocyte Count and Physical Exam
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Physical Examination Absolute Blood Lymphocyte Count

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Physical Examination Absolute Blood Lymphocyte Count
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.: The number of lymphocytes found in a given volume of blood.

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.
The number of lymphocytes found in a given volume of blood.

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.
